main.name: Jason Chow
main.occupation: 3rd Year student in Singapore University of Technology and Design(SUTD)
main.degree: Bachelor's Degree in Information Systems Technology and Design
main.description: I am also taking a minor in Product Development. While my area of interest is in robotics, I have an extensive background with backend and app development
main.bio: Being primarily a computer science student, I am most well-attuned to software technologies. I am extremely passionate and well-versed with backend frameworks, and cloud technologies. However, I also have a strong interest with embedded technologies and low-level programming, to go with my interest in robotics. Lastly, I am also no stranger to app development and front-end technologies

resume.skillmessage: I am most well-versed in Express.JS and Android App Development, but I have experience with many other technologies as well. For cloud-based technologies, I am familiar with AWS and Azure. I hope to continue moving on to enterprise-grade technologies like Spring Boot.

education.school: Singapore University of Tehchnology and Design
education.description: I have undertaken many academic and external projects (undergraduate research, hackathons, club projects) in my school, be it in the form of mobile appications, web applications or embedded system projects. I am part of Game Design Club, House Guardians (Hall Master), Digital Development and Design Club (Exco) and Uni-Y. Check out my projects below!
I was part of the GEP (Gifted Education Programme). I studied Physics, History, Math and Economics in College. Throughout my years, I was part of Robotics Club and Film & Media Society.

employment.title: Software Developer Intern
description: Coded digital-signing web app, complete with front-end(Angular) and back-end(NodeJS/Express) microservices.
Deployed applications on AWS, also containerised(Docker) microservices and deployed to Kubernetes.
Maintained applications running on Linux (Ubuntu Server) instances, using Nginx servers on AWS cloud
Oversaw DevOps work (CI/CD, Documentation) for the project, and also provided support to corporate partners.

employment.title: Combat Medic for Combat Engineer Platoon
description: Platoon Medic for Field Engineer Unit, took care of medical needs of platoon and helped out with their work

employment.title: Data Entry Clerk
description: Digitalised old records of students by performing data entry work

work.title: Spark-a-life Hackathon
description: Brainstormed a problem statement and solution for familial dementia caregivers in Singapore, performing in-dept market analysis and groundwork
Developed an Android mobile application, with a personalised digital journal, in-depth profiling techniques and a virtual assistant

Also created a Spring Boot backend sever, deployed on Azure Cloud that utilised Natural Langauge Processing techniques to identify red flags amongst caregivers, information would then be sent to various support groups to help out caregivers

work.title: Tactical Hull Climbing Robot
description: Created a hull climbing robot in collaboration with HTX, to help Home Team officers easily deploy ladders on top of ship hulls during ops
Robot was fully automated, with an option for override
Robot was powered by Arduino Uno, Raspberry Pi, and Roboclaw motor controller

work.title: Geolocation Tracker Research Project
description: Created geo-trackers that used triangulation to locate each other, potentially for use in fire-fighting scenarios or military operations
Used Arduino Pro Mini chips together with sensors as part of the trackers, programmed with C++

work.title: iNTUition v6.0 Hackathon
description: Created a Chrome extension (Perspective-Bot) running on Microsoft Azure, that broadens netizens’ knowledge and views on trending topics, by scraping through the internet for different perspectives and geographical statistics.
Information was then processed using Natural Language Processing (NLP) and clustering, then visualised to the user.
Prototype was awarded Best Cloud-based Hack.

work.title: Citi Social Hackathon
description: Working together with 3 other teams, my team developed a web application for social organisations to recruit volunteers for their events.
I was responsible for the back-end (NodeJS/Express) for my team’s part of the application.

work.title: Build-On Singapore
work.organisation: Organised by AWS, GovTech and NUS
description: Designed virtual voice assistant using Amazon Lex and voice recognition, that could perform digital services such as automatic form-filling using personal data collected from the government, complete with voice authentication.
Android mobile prototype achieved 3rd Runner-up.

work.title: VR Simulation of Water Processing Facility (VVater)
description: Designed and coded a VR experience, using Unity to simulate the environment of a water processing facility, to demonstrate to and educate users how to respond to attacks on the plant facility.
Held live demonstrations several times a month with visitor groups and foreign VIPs (e.g. Chilean President).
Project won Best Innovation Award at SUTD’s annual Research Fest.

work.title: Android University Lifestyle App
description: Team of 6 created an Android app for university students to find others who share similar interests.
Used machine learning algorithms(sklearn) to recommend interests to users based on past activities.
Integrated app with backend Python Flask server and SQLite database to store interests and events

work.title: Whack-a-Mole Game
description: Team of 5 created a Whack-a-Mole arcade game from scratch, procuring and assembling the materials and components ourselves.
Game was programmed from the ground-up using logic gates and a CPU architecture that we designed ourselves.

projects.category: Chrome Extension for gathering and broadening perspectives

projects.category: VR training demo for water plant facility
